actions.name: Attack
actions.description: Make a melee or ranged weapon attack against a target. Resolve attack roll and apply damage.

actions.name: Attack (Unarmed)
actions.description: Make an unarmed strike (punch, kick, headbutt) as a melee attack.

actions.name: Grapple
actions.description: Attempt to grab and restrain a target. Uses an Athletics check contested by the target's Athletics or Acrobatics.

actions.name: Shove
actions.description: Attempt to push a creature: either knock them prone or push them back 5 feet. Uses an Athletics check contested by target's Athletics or Acrobatics.

actions.name: Dodge
actions.description: Focus entirely on avoiding attacks. Until your next turn, attackers have disadvantage on attacks against you and you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects you can see.

actions.name: Dash
actions.description: Gain extra movement equal to your speed for this turn.

actions.name: Disengage
actions.description: Move without provoking opportunity attacks for the rest of the turn.

actions.name: Hide
actions.description: Attempt to become hidden. Make a Dexterity (Stealth) check contested by observers' passive or active Perception.

actions.name: Search
actions.description: Look carefully for traps, secret doors, hidden objects, or small details. Usually a Wisdom (Perception) or Intelligence (Investigation) check.

actions.name: Ready
actions.description: Prepare a trigger and an action to take later as a reaction when the trigger occurs (use an Action to Ready; consumes Reaction when triggered).

actions.name: Use Object
actions.description: Interact with or use an item that requires more than a free interaction (open a complex device, activate a magic item, pull a lever).

actions.name: Interact (Free)
actions.description: Perform a simple interaction with an object or the environment (draw a weapon, open a door, pick up an item) once during your turn for free.

actions.name: Help
actions.description: Grant an ally advantage on their next ability check or attack against a target within 5 feet of you (or short description when helping with perception).

actions.name: Stabilize
actions.description: Use medicine or a Wisdom (Medicine) check to stop a dying creature from losing more hit points. A stabilized creature remains unconscious but won't die.

actions.name: Administer First Aid
actions.description: Spend an Action to tend to a wounded ally, restoring a small amount of hit points using a successful Medicine check or provided supplies (DM adjudicated).

actions.name: Cast a Spell
actions.description: Cast a prepared or known spell, following its casting time, components, range, and effects. Some spells require concentration.

actions.name: Cast a Cantrip
actions.description: Cast a 0-level spell (cantrip). Cantrips usually do not consume spell slots and rarely require concentration.

actions.name: Use Bonus Action (General)
actions.description: Take any class/feature or item effect that specifically uses a Bonus Action (e.g., Two-Weapon Fighting off-hand attack, hunter's mark application where allowed).

actions.name: Two-Weapon Attack (Off-hand)
actions.description: When you attack with a light melee weapon in one hand, you can use a Bonus Action to make an off-hand attack with a light melee weapon in the other hand.

actions.name: Flurry of Blows / Martial Strike
actions.description: Representative bonus-action combat options used by many classes to make extra attacks or maneuvers (apply according to class rules).

actions.name: Reaction: Opportunity Attack
actions.description: Make a melee attack against a creature that leaves your reach. Uses your Reaction for the round.

actions.name: Reaction: Cast a Quick Reaction Spell
actions.description: Cast a spell with casting time 'Reaction' (e.g., Shield, Counterspell) when the specified trigger occurs.

actions.name: Reaction: Shield
actions.description: Raise a magical barrier (or use a shield) to increase AC or block an incoming attack as allowed by features or spells.

actions.name: Parry / Block
actions.description: Use a Reaction to reduce damage from an incoming attack or impose penalties on the attacker (depends on features or weapons).

actions.name: Ready a Reaction
actions.description: Choose a trigger and specify an action to use your Reaction on when the trigger occurs; you act immediately after the trigger.

actions.name: Use an Item (Consumable)
actions.description: Consume a potion, scroll, or other single-use item, applying its effect (some scrolls require spellcasting ability to use).

actions.name: Use a Magic Item (Activate)
actions.description: Activate a magic item's effect according to its description (may have charges, attunement, or require an Action/Bonus Action/Reaction).

actions.name: Identify
actions.description: Examine a magic item or effect to determine its properties and how to use it (Arcana check or Identify spell may be required).

actions.name: Search for Traps
actions.description: Carefully inspect an area or object for traps. Typically a Wisdom (Perception) or Intelligence (Investigation) check.

actions.name: Listen / Look Carefully
actions.description: Make an active Perception check to hear or spot something that passive perception might miss.

actions.name: Speak / Negotiate
actions.description: Talk, negotiate, taunt, or attempt persuasion/deception. Short speech typically doesn't require an Action; contested checks may be requested by DM.

actions.name: Intimidate / Coerce
actions.description: Try to force someone to act via threats or displays of force. Typically a Charisma (Intimidation) check contested by opponent's Wisdom (Insight) or similar.

actions.name: Persuade / Bargain
actions.description: Attempt to convince or influence someone using Charisma (Persuasion).

actions.name: Insight Check
actions.description: Assess motives, truthfulness, or emotional state of a creature (Wisdom (Insight) check). Often DM calls for it during conversation.

actions.name: Use Tools
actions.description: Employ a set of tools (thieves' tools, healer's kit, alchemist's supplies) to perform specialized tasks, often requiring ability checks.

actions.name: Disarm Device
actions.description: Attempt to disarm traps or deactivate devices using Thieves' Tools or an appropriate skill check.

actions.name: Mount / Dismount
actions.description: Mount or dismount a willing mount; typically costs half your movement. Interacting with an unfamiliar mount may require checks.

actions.name: Tame / Handle Animal
actions.description: Attempt to calm or handle an animal using Animal Handling (Wisdom) checks.

actions.name: Stun / Knockout (Non-lethal Attack)
actions.description: Use the Attack action to deal non-lethal damage to reduce a target to 0 hit points without killing them (attack rules apply).

actions.name: Stabilize (Healer's Kit)
actions.description: Use a healer's kit to stabilize a dying creature automatically without a check.

actions.name: Short Rest (Spend Hit Dice)
actions.description: Take a short rest to spend Hit Dice to regain hit points and recharge limited abilities according to class rules. Not an in-combat action but common between encounters.

actions.name: Long Rest
actions.description: Take an extended period (typically 8 hours) to restore hit points, hit dice, and class features per rest rules.

actions.name: Surrender / Yield
actions.description: Signal surrender or yield; subject to DM and opponents' reactions. May be allowed as part of roleplay without consuming an Action.

actions.name: Senses Check (Passive)
actions.description: Rely on passive Perception/Insight for noticing hidden or subtle things; DM compares passive values against DCs.

actions.name: Climb / Swim / Jump
actions.description: Move using Athletics checks or by spending movement to climb, swim, or jump; may require checks for difficult situations.

actions.name: Break Object
actions.description: Attempt to break a door, cage, or object with a Strength check or attack; objects often have set HP and AC.

actions.name: Tie Up / Restrain a Creature
actions.description: Use rope or bindings to restrain an incapacitated or willing creature; may require a check and time.

actions.name: Lift / Carry / Drag
actions.description: Attempt to lift, drag, or move heavy objects or creatures; strength checks may be required depending on weight.

actions.name: Senses: Detect Magic (if available)
actions.description: Use a spell, item, or ability to sense magical auras or effects in the area (e.g., Detect Magic).

actions.name: Initiative Roll (beginning of encounter)
actions.description: Roll initiative to determine order for the combat encounter; not an in-turn action but fundamental to encounters.

actions.name: Ready/Trigger Trap (Set)
actions.description: Attempt to set a trap or prepare an environmental hazard that triggers on a condition; may take time and tools.

actions.name: Soothe / Calming Touch
actions.description: Attempt to calm an enraged, frightened, or hostile creature using Persuasion or Medicine checks; DM adjudicates effects.

actions.name: Scry / Remote Observe
actions.description: Use a spell, item, or ability to observe a location or creature at a distance (subject to spell/item rules).

actions.name: Aid / Stabilize (Longer)
actions.description: Use extended care to stabilize or heal over time (bandaging, continuous tending); usually requires time or skill checks.

actions.name: Perform
actions.description: Entertain or perform for an audience to earn money or influence social situations; typically a Charisma (Performance) check.

actions.name: Scry / Counter-Scry
actions.description: Use a Reaction to counter or block a remote observation effect if you possess the appropriate feature or item.
